result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen L Harper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court waives fine due to financial instability.

Pay all costs and surcharges by 06-07-2016. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court orders defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge.
with credit for 1 day.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen L Harper

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JOC corrected to change due date for the DNA surcharge.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

As to Count 1:
Court sentences defendant to serve 1 day in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to provide a DNA sample a pay DNA surcharge.

Court orders defendant to pay all costs and surcharges by 6/7/2016. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court waives fine due to financial instability.

Defendant Stephen L Harper in court with attorney Christopher R Smith.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

As to Count 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

As to Count 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Stephen L Harper in court with attorney Christopher R Smith.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. Defense counsel requests jury trial date. 

Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by the final pretrial date.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 37.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Stephen L Harper in court with attorney Christopher Smith.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Pre-trial conference held off the record.

Defense counsel has received discovery and offer, additional time to review discovery with his client.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.

Defendant Stephen L Harper in court.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dee, Br. 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 8/14/15 @ 1:30 pm
